Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw different types of habitats, including both land (e.g., playground, garden, forest) and water (e.g., pond, stream, lake) habitats.
The student can illustrate and label a variety of living things found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can make comparisons in their drawing to show different types of living things that exist across different habitats.
The student can observe and represent patterns of plant and animal diversity within and across habitats through their drawings.
The student can clearly organize their drawing to demonstrate how plants and animals are distributed in different habitats, providing a visual comparison of the diversity.
